kp.berg,

> I know, JUnit 'unit' tests should always pass ;-) But we are using the 
> JUnit framework to write integration and systemtests as well. So from 
> time to time, in this area something may go wrong. Therefore I'm 
> looking for a tool, that generates a report showing only the 
> differences between current and last JUnit report - which failing 
> tests were fixed, which tests stopped to pass, which tests were added 
> and which removed. Additionaly a test trend analysis should be 
> possible.
> 
> I know, parsing the XML junitreport output and generating the info, 
> e.g., with the help of a database, would be possible. But is anyone 
> aware of an existing tool or open source project that can help in this 
> direction?

In the Maven world, there's a plugin called Maven Historical Data 
(http://mavenhistorical.sourceforge.net) that sounds like it would meet 
at least some of your needs. Specificially, it maintains a Hibernate 
database of information scraped from JUnit reports, and builds some nice 
graphs. Unlike most Maven plugins, it doesn't appear to built on top of 
a corresponding Ant library, so it may be useless to you if you don't 
use Maven.
